title: Did the scientific revolution affect religion? - Quora

response.answer_text: yes it did, it completely refuted some of the religious Dogma held for years. But such a question always reminds me of voltaire's quote. If God didn't exist we would have a need to invent him. One must draw their own conclusions on religion. I'm a man of science, but I will not militantly opposed believers. That is the moral thing to do. We can exhibit morals without religion. In fact it's a necessity.

Did the scientific revolution affect religion? What scientific revolution would that be? I haven’t heard of it until now. Religion is made up by men telling each other what to do. It might be anything. It’s possible to have more religions than people. So which religion do you mean?
